results.title: Burn, bury or what?
results.brief_description: Describes how the District of Columbia solved its problem of solid waste disposal by developing a technically sound long-range plan. Illustrates how other cities can solve solid waste disposal problems by using sanitary landfill, accomplished through the use of the latest engineering techniques.

results.title: Burn emergency
results.creator_credit: Rick Wise, Sheldon Renan, Pyramid Films and Renan Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the most current methods of caring for burn victims, including thermal, inhalation, electrical and chemical burns, until they can reach a hospital. Demonstrates how to estimate the extent of burn damage and how to take an accident and medical history quickly to facilitate later treatment. Suitable for upper primary and secondary school levels.

results.title: Burma: people of the river
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The varied regions and ways of living in Burma - the rivers that serve as highways; the rice fields in the delta and river valleys; jungle that yields harvests of teakwood and bamboo; the village life; and the city of Rangoon, centre of commerce, transportation and ancient culture.

results.title: Burma victory
results.creator_credit: Roy Boulting, David Macdonald and Army Film Unit
results.brief_description: Compilation of footage covering the Burma campaign against the Japanese between 1942 and 1945. For censorship reasons this campaign was given very little newsreel coverage and the footage was assembled into an absorbing narrative. Footage taken by British, Indian and American Combat Cameramen of South-East Asia Command.

results.title: Sebastian the fox: the burglar
results.creator_credit: Tim Burstall, Patrick Ryan and Eltham Films
results.brief_description: Puppet film for children. Sebastian the Fox, caught in the rain, seeks refuge in a warm house. A burglar later enters the same house and disturbs the occupant. She mistakes Sebastian for the intruder, but he then catches the real burglar, and is suitably rewarded.

results.title: Bunraku: puppet theatre of Japan
results.creator_credit: Nichiei Kagaku Eiga Productions and Sakura Motion Pictures
results.brief_description: Traditional performances at the Bunraku-za Theatre, Osaka, show the style of this unusual 18th century form, still popular in Japan. The Bunraku dolls, half life-size, create a make-believe world peculiar to Japan, and are so delicate that they cannot be imitated by live actors.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nichiei Kagaku Eiga Productions and Sakura Motion Pictures

results.title: Bunker Hill, 1956
results.creator_credit: Kent Mackenzie, Merl Edelman and University of Southern California
results.brief_description: A study of the people who live in the downtown section of Los Angeles called Bunker Hill. Presents a typical day in their lives and the problems they must face when uprooted by the razing of the section for building offices. Uses recorded voices of the residents. Makes a plea for the preservation of Bunker Hill.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kent Mackenzie, Merl Edelman and University of Southern California

results.title: Bundy into dreamland
results.creator_credit: Curtis Levy, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working series”.
One of a series of films about attitudes to work. Part-time musicians discuss the problems of making a reasonable living with a band. In order to earn a living they must work at other, more mundane jobs, such as in a factory or a production line. They pursue their musical careers at nights.

results.title: Buma: African sculpture speaks
results.creator_credit: Henry R. Cassirer and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Twenty different antique sculptures from Central and West Africa are used to illustrate the important part played by carved wooden statues and masks in the everyday life of native Africans. The use of masks as protection or reassurance against common dangers and fears is dramatised with the assistance of tribal drum music actually recorded in Africa. Antique sculpture used in the film is from the Segy Galleries, New York.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Henry R. Cassirer and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Bullfight
results.brief_description: Anna Sokolow recreates and reacts to a remembered bullfight and through her dancing recaptures her feelings while watching the fight. The climax is reached when the dancer identifies with the bullfighter, the bull and the death in the ring.
